page.title: 01Land Cover - General
page.content: The prominent feature of this block is the River Walkham which runs from N to S. It is flanked principally by open moorland, with a few fields used for grazing and hay. The moors have several outcrops of granite (tors) surrounded by clitter. Other than agriculture, there is no industry except numerous sites of derelict quarries and tin mining. There is one small village, Sampford Spiney, and all lies within the Dartmoor National Park. There are no roads of any consequence although the N boundary of the block is adjacent to the Tavistock - Princetown road which provides access for considerable numbers of tourists in the summer, this being one of only two roads across Dartmoor.
